Get conference-level S&P+ historical rating data

cfb_ratings_sp_conference.Rd

Get conference-level S&P+ historical rating data

cfb_ratings_sp_conference(year = NULL, conference = NULL)

Arguments

year

(Integer optional): Year, 4 digit format (YYYY)
conference

(String optional): Conference abbreviation - S&P+ information by conference
Conference abbreviations P5: ACC, B12, B1G, SEC, PAC
Conference abbreviations G5 and FBS Independents: CUSA, MAC, MWC, Ind, SBC, AAC

Source

https://api.collegefootballdata.com/ratings/sp/conferences

Value

A data frame with 25 variables:

year

integer.

conference

character.

rating

double.

second_order_wins

logical.

sos

logical.

offense_rating

double.

offense_success

logical.

offense_explosiveness

logical.

offense_rushing

logical.

offense_passing

logical.

offense_standard_downs

logical.

offense_passing_downs

logical.

offense_run_rate

logical.

offense_pace

logical.

defense_rating

double.

defense_success

logical.

defense_explosiveness

logical.

defense_rushing

logical.

defense_passing

logical.

defense_standard_downs

logical.

defense_passing_downs

logical.

defense_havoc_total

logical.

defense_havoc_front_seven

logical.

defense_havoc_db

logical.

special_teams_rating

double.

Examples


cfb_ratings_sp_conference(year = 2019)

#> 2020-12-21 07:45:14: Scraping conference-level S&P+ ratings data...
#>    year        conference     rating second_order_wins sos offense_rating

#> 2  2019 American Athletic   1.350000                NA  NA       29.08333

#> 2020-12-21 07:45:14: Scraping conference-level S&P+ ratings data...
#>   year conference   rating second_order_wins       sos offense_rating
#> 1 2012        SEC 15.72143              7.85 0.8165714       34.77857
#>   offense_success offense_explosiveness offense_rushing offense_passing
#> 1        105.0786              104.3857        105.5857        104.2786
#>   offense_standard_downs offense_passing_downs offense_run_rate offense_pace
#> 1               103.4357                 107.8        0.5085714          0.5

#> 1       19.55714        107.7214              107.6643        110.2643
